lowCode.challenge: Financial institutions needed a way to rapidly build and deploy custom applications without extensive development resources. Traditional development cycles were too slow and expensive, with duplicated code across projects and no centralized component management. The company needed a platform that would dramatically reduce time-to-market while maintaining quality and consistency.
lowCode.solution: I contributed to and progressively took ownership of the frontend development of a comprehensive low-code platform built on an NX monorepo architecture with Angular 20, RxJS, NgRx, and Signals. Over the last 3 years, I co-led development alongside a colleague, driving major technical decisions. The platform enables users to design UML diagrams that generate backend code, create Angular frontends through drag-and-drop in the visual designer, write custom implementations in an embedded VS Code editor, and build/run applications with real-time log monitoring. I architected and implemented a reusable component library of 75+ widgets exposed via Storybook, integrated complex libraries (bpmn.js for business process modeling, CodeMirror, JointJS, GridStack), and built real-time features including a notifications center with WebSocket integration and log streaming from Grafana. I also created the SASS/CSS theming system for the platform's rebranding and developed the design system theme for all generated applications.
lowCode.results: The platform now serves 3 major financial institutions with 150+ active users, reducing application development time by 40%. Over 5 years, I resolved 520+ bugs and delivered 110+ features. The component library achieved 93%+ test coverage. CI/CD optimizations resulted in 65% faster build times, 30% fewer pipeline failures, and 30% reduction in build artifact size. Successfully contributed to multiple Angular upgrades, with the latest migration to Angular v20 affecting both the platform and all generated applications.
highlights: Contributed to frontend development for 5 years; co-led development in the last 3 years alongside a colleague
Resolved 520+ bugs and delivered 110+ features across the platform lifecycle
Architected and implemented a reusable component library of 75+ widgets with 93%+ test coverage
Created SASS/CSS theming system for platform rebranding and design system theme for generated applications
Built real-time notifications center with REST API and WebSocket integration
Implemented log streaming and management from Grafana WebSocket connections
Integrated and customized bpmn.js for business process modeling within the platform
Drove multiple Angular version upgrades including the latest migration to Angular v20
Integrated complex libraries: CodeMirror (code editing), JointJS (diagrams), GridStack (layouts)
Managed frontend CI/CD pipelines achieving 65% faster builds and 30% smaller artifacts
Exposed component library via Storybook with comprehensive documentation and visual testing
Mentored junior developers and established coding patterns adopted across the organization

pijiz.challenge: The client needed a professional e-commerce store that reflected their brand identity, supported multiple languages, and integrated with their delivery management system. The store needed to be set up quickly while maintaining a polished, professional appearance.
pijiz.solution: Purchased a Shopify template and customized it to match the brand's visual identity. Set up pages, collections, and product catalog structure. Implemented a cash-on-delivery payment system with webhook integration that automatically creates deliveries in a third-party delivery management platform when orders are confirmed by the merchant. Configured internationalization for English and French, integrated an Instagram feed widget via a Shopify app, and built a custom coming soon page before public launch. Purchased and configured the custom domain with DNS setup, and created professional email accounts using the domain.
pijiz.results: The store launched successfully with a fully customized brand experience. The cash-on-delivery system with webhook integration streamlined the order-to-delivery workflow. The coming soon page generated anticipation before launch, and the multi-language support expanded the store's reach to international customers.
highlights: Customized Shopify template to match brand visual identity
Set up pages, collections, and product catalog structure
Implemented cash-on-delivery payment system with webhook integration to third-party delivery management platform
Configured internationalization for English and French language support
Integrated Instagram feed widget via Shopify app for social media presence
Built custom coming soon page before public launch
Purchased and configured custom domain with DNS setup
Set up professional email accounts using the custom domain
Added website to Google Search Console for indexing

banking.challenge: A major banking application was running on Angular v11, which was approaching end-of-life. The codebase had accumulated technical debt, custom themes that weren't compatible with newer Angular versions, and the team needed to modernize without disrupting ongoing development.
banking.solution: Led a phased migration strategy that allowed the team to continue feature development while upgrading. Refactored legacy modules to use modern Angular patterns, migrated the custom theme system to CSS variables for better maintainability, and updated all dependencies systematically.
banking.results: Successfully upgraded to Angular v16 with zero production incidents. Build times improved by 45%, and the modernized codebase enabled the team to implement new features 30% faster. The migration also resolved 50+ long-standing bugs related to the outdated framework.
highlights: Led full framework migration from Angular v11 to v16
Refactored legacy modules to modern Angular patterns
Migrated custom theme system to CSS variables
Achieved zero production incidents during migration
Improved build times by 45%
Resolved 50+ long-standing framework-related bugs
